awd_titl_txt: Cluster Algebras, the Ising Model, and Affine Kazhdan-Lusztig Cells
awd_abstract_narration:
The PI is interested in algebraic combinatorics and its relations to other areas of mathematics. Algebraic combinatorics is a unique area in that it interacts closely with a truly wide range of scientific subjects. For example, cluster algebras studied by the PI arise in many areas of mathematics (representation theory, geometry, combinatorics, dynamical systems) and physics (string theory, scattering amplitudes, integrable systems). Discovered around the year 2000 cluster algebras provide an amazing unifying framework for many questions. The PI is interested in deepening these connections, and finding even more ways in which mathematics and physics are a single science. The projects also provide research training opportunities for graduate students.

The four projects the PI will work on pertain to cluster algebras, the Ising model, and Kazhdan-Lusztig theory. In the first project the PI plans to continue his work on classifying periodic and integrable T-systems, as well as studying their properties. In the second project the PI plans to work on a tensor diagram approach to higher Teichmuller theory. In a recent work the PI and a coauthor have used Postnikov's plabic graphs to give a comprehensive description of correlation functions of the Ising model in terms of inequalities. In the third project the PI plans to work on using those results to derive properties of limits of correlation functions, as well as on extending those results to other statistical mechanics models. Finally, in the fourth project the PI plans to use the generalized Robinson-Schensted insertion he developed to study affine Kazhdan-Lusztig theory.

por.por_cntn:
While funded by DMS-1949896, the PI 

- published 10 papers, and wrote 8 preprints submitted for publication;

- trained 5 Ph.D. students and 2 postdocs;

- mentored 15 REU students.

The specific research results include:

- progress towards proving Stanley-Stembridge conjecture 

"Robinson-Schensted correspondence for unit interval orders"

"Noncommutative Schur functions for posets"

"The Stanley-Stembridge Conjecture for 2+1+1-avoiding unit interval orders: a diagrammatic proof"

- developing theory of RSK map and Knuth equivalence for flag variety Schubert calculus

"Knuth moves for Schubert polynomials"

"Bumpless pipe dream RSK, growth diagrams, and Schubert structure constants"

- systematization of projective incidence geometry

"Incidences and tilings"

- progress in understanding positivity of dual canonical basis

"Temperley-Lieb Crystals"

- developing theory similar to GIT for geometric crystals

"Crystal invariant theory I: Geometric RSK"

"Crystal invariant theory II: Pseudo-energies"

- developing theory of multi-port electrical networks with applications to electrical networks on surfaces.

"Superport networks"

- developing tensor diagram representation for cluster algebras on surfaces with punctures, coming from higher Techmuller theory

"Tensor diagrams and cluster combinatorics at punctures"

The results were presented at a number of conferences and seminars, both by the PI and by his coauthors and mentees. Several exciting directions of further research were discovered.
